lst.name: sentence
lst.str: In addition, March trading included two single-day volume records: British pound futures traded 35,960 contracts March 9 compared to 33,269 February 19, and Canadian dollar futures traded 20,905 contracts March 11 compared to the previous record of 12,456 set May 12, 1982.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) traded a record 19,656,498 contracts in the first quarter of 1987, up 17 pct from 16,768,145 in the same quarter last year.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The Standard and Poor's 500, the second most actively traded futures contract anywhere, traded 1,780,538 contracts in March, up 4.9 pct from 1,696,912 in March 1986.
